byline.original: By AARON M. KESSLER and DANIELLE IVORY

lead_paragraph: United States agents investigating Trinity Industries have questioned at least five witnesses, including a former Federal Highway Administration official, say people with knowledge of the inquiry.

headline.print_headline: Guardrail Maker Is Said to Be Focus of U.S. Case
headline.main: Guardrail Maker Is Said to Be Focus of U.S. Case

snippet: United States agents investigating Trinity Industries have questioned at least five witnesses, including a former Federal Highway Administration official, say people with knowledge of the inquiry.
abstract: Justice Dept has started criminal investigation of Trinity Industries that will focus on company's ties with Federal Highway Administration; investigation stems from case Trinity lost in 2014, where jury found it liable for failing to disclose to government design changes to its guardrail units that may have made them more dangerous.
